intro: Memecylon molestum, commonly known as the rough memecylon, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, rough hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release the seeds.
